summary: Lalalune is actively contributing to the project by updating documentation, fixing Discord voice and direct message functionalities, and adding template overrides. They have merged three pull requests related to these improvements and resolved an issue regarding character paths in code areas such as docs and core. Their work primarily focuses on enhancements and documentation updates.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #198 from HashWarlock/add-redpill

Add RedPill API Support

Merge pull request #196 from MarcoMandar/main

swap Dao action initital

pull_requests.title: add the template overrides
pull_requests.body:
This PR adds template overrides. This relates to this issue: https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/206

If you add overrides to your character file, it will use these templates in place of the templates that are in the code. Obviously how the templates work and what they are is opaque, and will require looking into the code for them. Fortunately, the template variable names are the same as the overrides.

We should add documentation and some kind of tutorial / explanation of templates and how to modify them, but for now lets get this in so our partners can use it.

pull_requests.title: Shaw fix characters paths, .ts requirement and missings args
pull_requests.body:
After merging some of the new trust score code there were some missing arguments.

Character paths were offset by "../" after the monorepo change, so calling the core from the monorepo will now add a "../" via the "rootDir" flag, which can also be used elsewhere for init if necessary.

For some reason it breaks on my computer when no .ts but doesn't seem to on other people's computers. Added the .ts to file path imports.

pull_requests.title: Fix Discord Voice and DMs
pull_requests.body: Was working in voice and another team asked for me to review voice chat. Seemed like there were some bugs. Resolved voice chat issues, noticed DMs were not working due to some new validation code. Fixed that. DMs and voice should now work.

opened.title: Add template overrides to docs
opened.body:
You can now override all templates (except for some actions). We need to add this to docs in a way that is clear and part of the advanced character customization process.
```
        "messageHandlerTemplate": "", // you can just use these for all platforms
        "shouldRespondTemplate": "",

        "discordMessageHandlerTemplate": "", // or be more specific per platform
        "discordShouldRespondTemplate": "",
        "discordVoiceHandlerTemplate": "",

        "telegramMessageHandlerTemplate": "",
        "telegramShouldRespondTemplate": "",

        "twitterPostTemplate": "",
        "twitterMessageHandlerTemplate": "",
        "twitterSearchTemplate": "",
        "twitterShouldRespondTemplate": "",

"continueMessageHandlerTemplate": "", // overrides the messageHandlerTemplate, which overrides internal template


        "goalsTemplate": "",
        "factsTemplate": "",
        "evaluationTemplate": ""
        ```

summary: Ponderingdemocritus is currently focused on integrating the 'eliza' project into their own codebase, as evidenced by a recent merge commit from its GitHub repository. This activity shows an emphasis on collaboration and expanding functionality within ponderingdemocritus's work.

Sirkitree is currently focused on reviewing documentation for the project, as evidenced by their recent activity on GitHub. They have not yet merged any pull requests or made code changes but are actively engaged in addressing one issue related to documentation improvements.

opened.title: Docs review
opened.body:
## Homepage
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/39c26715-9400-4b90-8816-d5e363dcb023)
* ... designed to be ~~and~~ easy to use (strike the 'and')

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/135f0e0a-d760-46d1-b7c4-31c60d915727)
* This discord invite is invalid.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b3dd900f-3252-40ae-a575-a81afadf845c)
* Just curious, but what is the "b" icon? Should we make like an AI one? or is this something to do with the docs framework?

## API
* In general, API docs typically have a standard format that provides the interface, parameters, endpoints, etc. for something like a REST API. So when clicking this, I was not expecting to see setup instructions. It seems like this is mostly duplicate info from the "[Getting Started](https://elizaos.github.io/eliza/docs/quickstart/)" section. There isn't really an API, so I'd suggest we just remove this section for now.
* Possibly replace with with some documentation about how the core information flows from the Agent Runtime, to the Memory System, the Room-based Organization, Information Processing Pipeline, Provider Integration, and State Management - though these could all be valid sections under the Advanced Concepts section as well on the Documentation page.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55c6d401-9b6b-4f49-90f7-528ffb4acefb)
*  banner image is broken

comments.author: madjin
comments.body:
I did a huge overhaul of docs, still much more to do (looking around for a new icon/logo to replace that b)

https://elizaos.github.io/eliza/docs/intro/

Some to-do plans:
- prettify overall (icons to table of contents)
- add some architecture diagrams (LLM -> mermaid diagram)
- improve api docs (make code more readable / add comments for better autodocs)
  - generate code2prompt templates: https://github.com/raphaelmansuy/code2prompt
- test and ensure documentation is up to date (go through everything after refactor code merges)
- add more visuals

summary: Madjin is actively working on improving documentation by fixing Docusaurus URLs, updating the package-lock for docs, and managing their main branch. Their recent activity shows a commitment to maintaining clean code changes, as evidenced by +25033 lines added and -746 lines removed across three commits.

MarcoMandar is actively working on improving the recommender system, integrating token performance into swapping mechanisms, and merging pull requests to enhance core functionalities within the project. His recent contributions include three commits that have resulted in a net increase of 25,017 lines of code changes.

merge from main

merge from main

recommender, token performane integration to swap

Signed-off-by: MarcoMandar <malicemandar@gmail.com>

summary: Yodamaster726 is currently focused on resolving issues related to building local documentation, as evidenced by their recent activity on GitHub. They have not yet contributed any pull requests or commits but are actively engaged in addressing a single issue within the realms of documentation and bug fixes.

opened.title: build docs locally gives errors
opened.body:

Using the latest code as of 11/4/2024 - 10pm EST

comments.author: lalalune
comments.body: Yeah its weird, seems to make the mds but cuts off at that part, seems to be related to how some files are compiled in the docusaurus mdx typedoc chain. Maybe updating could fix.

comments.author: yodamaster726
comments.body:
works good now.  thanks for fixing.

verified with node 23.1
